ygData.subject: Re: FW:  /shout Hello Everyone!
ygData.msgSnippet: Being a Viet Nam era vet (never in country) I just want to thank you for what you are doing. So many of my brother vets served in country and saw so little
ygData.messageBody:
Being a Viet Nam era vet (never in country) I just want to thank you
for what you are doing. So many of my brother vets served in country
and saw so little appreciation. Thanks for serving in difficult times,
whatever your contribution.

Sorry you can't get the bandwidth to play while away. Hope you can get
what you need via the books and sites like this. Thanks again for your
service.

Michael R. Lockrige
U.S. Army SP4
92nd Ord. Det.
72 ADCom.
Ramstein Airforce Base
Ramstein, Germany
1972-1975

--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, STG2 Pierce <piercer@d...> wrote:
>
> Hello everyone I'm new to this club and my name is Ron and I'm a EQ
addict
> lol. I just thought I'd introduce myself to everyone and give a little
> background info about myself. Well I've been playing EQ for about 2
years
> now and I love it. I play on Ayonae Ro and my main is a 29 troll
warrior
> and I also have a 25 iksar necro, 12 human monk, and the rest of my
> characters are just throw away ones, I wanted to experiment to see
how the
> different classes play like. Well I'm also in the navy out here in
the gulf
> and I'm stationed in Everett, WA. I haven't played EQ since March
2nd (we
> left for westpac March 3rd) and I won't be able to play until we get
back
> sometime in middle November. I have with me here on the ship just about
> every EQ book/guide that came out lol from Kunark to Luclin to the
EQ Atlas
> and the EQ spellbook..I read them whenever I have EQ withdrawls
(which is
> everyday). So yeah I just can't wait to come back to the states and
play
> again. Well I guess I'd better get going for now, take care
everyone and
> happy hunting!
>
>
> /camp
